item.title: Supporting the goals and ideals of National Public Works Week.

latestAction.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Water Resources and Environment.

item.text: Submitted in the Senate, considered, and agreed to without amendment and with a preamble by Unanimous Consent. (consideration: CR S4503-4504; text as passed Senate: CR S4504; text of measure as introduced: CR S4478)

Passed/agreed to in Senate: Submitted in the Senate, considered, and agreed to without amendment and with a preamble by Unanimous Consent.(consideration: CR S4503-4504; text as passed Senate: CR S4504; text of measure as introduced: CR S4478)

summary.text: Proclaims the week of May 21-May 27, 2006, as National Public Works Week.

(This measure has not been amended since it was introduced. The summary has been expanded because action occurred on the measure.)

Proclaims the week of May 21-May 27, 2006, as National Public Works Week.

Recognizes the contributions that public works professionals make every day to improve U.S. public infrastructure and the communities that they serve.

bill.title: A resolution proclaiming the week of May 21 through May 27, 2006, as "National Public Works Week".

item.title: A resolution proclaiming the week of May 21 through May 27, 2006, as "National Public Works Week".
A resolution proclaiming the week of May 21 through May 27, 2006, as "National Public Works Week".

latestAction.text: Submitted in the Senate, considered, and agreed to without amendment and with a preamble by Unanimous Consent. (consideration: CR S4503-4504; text as passed Senate: CR S4504; text of measure as introduced: CR S4478)

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
